title: Understanding Strong Acids
text: Remember that strong acids, like HCl, completely dissociate in water. This means that the concentration of HCl will be equal to the concentration of H⁺ ions in the solution.

title: Mass Balance Equation
text: For a solution of HCl, the mass balance equation is straightforward. Since HCl dissociates completely, the concentration of HCl is equal to the concentration of H⁺ ions.

title: Charge Balance Equation
text: In a solution of HCl, the charge balance equation is: [H⁺] $$=$$ [Cl⁻]. This is because the number of positive charges from H⁺ ions must equal the number of negative charges from Cl⁻ ions.

title: Equilibrium Relationships
text: For strong acids like HCl, the equilibrium relationship is simplified because the acid dissociates completely. Therefore, the equilibrium constant is not needed for calculations.

title: Calculate the pH
text: Given that the concentration of H⁺ ions is $$0.0100$$ M, use the formula pH $$=$$ -log[H⁺] to find the pH of the solution.
